page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content:
{Chaddesden}is dominated by{council {estates.}The original village grew up around its church and landowner's park, where you can still find {cottages and private housing.}There are Edwardian{terraced houses}on Nottingham Road. The late 1930s saw the first council estate in Chaddesden which was followed by others until the 1960s. These estates grew up as farm lands were taken over by{Derby {Corporation. }
The most recent house building programme in the area is at{Oakwood, to the north of Chaddesden. This is a private development which is expected to take fifteen years to complete. It is thought to be one of the largest single building projects in Europe.
